result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron K. Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

DNA sample.  Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to Amend Information from Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense) to Ct. 1 (Possession of Amphetamine-Repeater)-COURT GRANTS
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Amphetamine-Repeater)>>GUILTY
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/H, 2 years probation to be concurrent with the sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate, Full time work/Full time education, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, AODA and follow up, Court Costs.
